quote: My grandparents were proud immigrants to the United States of America, here to Illinois in the late 1800s. My grandparents did not speak English when they were young.
quotePlain: My grandparents were proud immigrants to the United States of America, here to Illinois in the late 1800s. My grandparents did not speak English when they were young.
name: Bruce Rauner

checks.quote: We have no reason to doubt that Rauner’s grandparents meant the world to him. But the Census plainly refutes his claim that they were immigrants. What’s more, both couldn’t have come to the U.S. in the late 1800s because they weren’t even born until the early 1900s — in Wisconsin, not Sweden. Rauner’s assertion in August that his grandparents immigrated to Illinois is yet another inaccuracy.
checks.short: Census records and Rauner’s own admission show that this statement has no credibility.

claims.title: Bruce Rauner's grandparents were immigrants
claims.negative: Bruce Rauner's gradparent were not immigrants
claims.negativePlain: Bruce Rauner’s gradparent were not immigrants
claims.truth: Census reports, as well as Rauner's previous statements, refute this.
